intro: Dactylorhiza praetermissa var. bracteosa, commonly known as the bracteosa orchid, is a terrestrial orchid native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and heaths. The plant features a slender rhizome and produces a single spike of pale to deep purple flowers. Its leaves are linear and arranged in a rosette, and the flowers have three sepals and three petals. This orchid is noted for its ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils and is often found in association with other orchid species.
